Articles.Content:
Today, the Asteroid Day mod was released by KSP developers at SQUAD as an official DLC.

Here are the things it included if you missed the announcement:

New Parts!

  • The Sentinel Infrared Telescope mimics the real world Sentinel mission
  • The HECS-2 Probe Core comes with integrated batteries and SAS, to make
    building a compact Sentinel probe much easier.
  • The OX-STAT-XL Photovoltaic Panels are a much larger version of the stock
    static solar panels, for larger probes.
  • The HG-55 High Gain Antenna can transmit larger amounts of data than any
    of the existing antennae in the game.
    New Contract!
  • Your mission will be to recreate the Sentinal mission profile in Kerbal Space Program,
    deploying a telescope around EveÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s orbit. When deployed with an antenna and a
    power source between Eve and Kerbin, aligned to face away from the Sun, and
    activated, the telescope will begin to map the orbit of the outer planet in a 200Ã‚Â°
    vision cone for passing asteroids.

This thread is to discuss the addon. What do you think of it?

*the descriptions were taken directly from the announcement to retain accuracy, I hope this isn't a problem.

It is on curse.com.
You place the sentinel between any two planets you want and it will map asteroids along the orbit of the outer planet.

It works in high, and presumably low(haven't tested) Kerbol orbit.

When it's on, it detects asteroids facing away from Kerbol in a cone-shape. While it's scanning, you'll see asteroids coming into and falling out of detection.

Well, the actual IR telescope part is in the Science Tech node, same as the Ore survey and surface scanners, the one that looks like a telescope in the 550-point tier. So you can't get it until you're reasonably far along in a career game. So small amounts of science as 1-shot things aren't too valuable by this point, but having a steady income is very helpful.

As to the other parts, the OX-STAT-XL is in Advanced Electrics with the unshielded folding solar panels (130-point tier, bottom node) and the HECS-2 is in Advanced Unmanned (last full column, 3rd from bottom). I haven't yet found where the high-gain antenna is hiding. But in any case, it will take you a while to collect the full set .

So we can have asteroids around Duna now? Awesome

Or put it between Duna and Dres to turn Dres' orbit into a real asteroid belt, and then recreate the Dawn mission

Or have an easier time towing 'roids to outer planets to use as fuel. If you can wave your wand to make roids appear in the orbit you want, then you don't need to drag them on interplanetary transfers from Kerbin's neighborhood .

All in all, I really like this little pack of parts. All the parts look useful in the regular course of business, besides their contract gig. Now we just need for RT2 and AR to incorporate the new antenna .
